CatDescriptText: James E. Wright, 8355 Bricelyn Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 1, 1958, pg. 9 with question: "Do you believe in corporal (paddling) punishment for students, in the elementary grades, who misbehave? If so, who should mete [sic]  out the punishment-- the teacher or the principal?" answer reads: "I must say yes, because I came up that way myself and so did my children.  I think that the teachers should bet he one who deal it out because they are familiar with the situation, day-in and day-out.  And the reason is because the children should know what discipline is."
TitMainTitle: James E. Wright wearing dark belted trench coat and dark hat with brim marked "R.E. Co.", holding newspaper under arm, standing in front of glass block window and door with sign inscribed "Cafeteria good food and fast service", sidewalk with pedestrians and sign for Penn Camera Photo Supply store on right
